summary: Absolutely Smitten
title: Absolutely Smitten
body:
Request: Hey, I was wondering if you could do a teen!tony x reader were the reader is the new to his high school and he somehow is the person to show her around. But it’s like a love at first sight thing. Kinda based off of Absolutely Smitten by Dodie. If you don’t mind. Thank you!!💖💖 can’t wait to read it

A/N: Oh my GOOOD the song is so cute, I can totally imagine young tony with it. sfsdjfhbsfhdsbdhs i’m having very warm feelings. Robert, you make my heart do flips. I love this. And I love Tony. Currently watching “Restoration” which is in my rdj’s film list in caps because he’s got long hair in this movie (sfjsbh). Happy reading! (this gif screams “i’m going to allow that”)

Warnings: extreme cuteness and sickening love-at-first-sight stuff. Read at your own risk!!

Am I really lost on my first day?

The question slips through her mind several times as her desperate eyes search for something to point her in the right direction. There’s no sign, no nothing. And no people around, as well. How is she ever going to find the counselor’s office if she doesn’t know where it is?!

Y/N begins to walk towards the end of the hall she has not yet discovered. Couldn’t go wrong walking here, she thinks to herself. But suddenly, out of the silence and loneliness, she hears footsteps. Lousy, loud as well, probably belonging to a guy. She stops, hoping he’s one of the students and can tell her where to go.

It is a guy, indeed, and he wants to tap her shoulder with his pointer finger to alert her with his presence, but she’s already turning around. He’s a bit late to withdraw his hand and it hangs in the air as he stares at the completely breathtaking stranger.

“Wow.” He says and raises his eyebrows. Y/N eyes his hand warily and furrows her eyebrows. The guy immediately retracts his hand and lets it fall by his side. 

“Wow what?” She asks, straightening her posture and taking a small step back from him. She does this everytime she meets someone new because she is a bit afraid of every stranger. But this stranger… well, his good looks certainly earn him first-impression trust. It shouldn’t be taken deeper, though, she knows that.

“Wow you.” He says. “You, I found you, I was looking for you. And now I found you, and I say wow.” He speaks in a fast manner and Y/N has to take a short while to figure out what she heard. 

“Okay, um,” she starts to say, “wh-why were you looking for me?”

“I am to,” he starts now, and bends a little, extracting his arm to her, in an old-fashioned polite manner, “show you around your—obviously—new school.” 

She laughs and he lingers on how it looks. A spectacular apparition, her laugh and smile. And that he’s caused it—miraculous. He stands back up and straightens his jacket, smiling sheepishly at the girl. She’s the most charming girl he’s ever seen, he’s sure of it. Her charms seem to be quite unplanned and natural. And her smile. Oh, her smile. 

“Thank God.” Y/N says. “I thought I was lost on my first day already.” She offers him a nervous smile and he gives her a wider in response. Though when she sees it, he narrows it down to a polite smile. He’s shy. He’s shy? Tony Stark’s shy? Of a stranger? A damn beautiful one at that. “Hello? I don’t know your name, but you seem to have drifted, so—”

“Yes, we’re going.” He says and starts walking in the direction Y/N was already headed to. “I should probably tell you who I am.” He says it in a way that makes her think she should know his name, know who he is. As if it’s a fact. “I’m Tony. Tony Stark.” He extends his hand towards her again and this time, she shakes it. Even if she is unsure of the horrid formality of his gestures. 

“I’m Y/N.” She says in response and realises she doesn’t know his name, even if she’s supposed to. “I would say my last name, but since yours is much more brighter and cooler, I won’t.” She admits.

“Ridiculous!” Tony says. “Although, thank you, I know it’s cool. Or whatever.” He takes it as a compliment, due to his arrogant ways. Back to my own self, at least, he thinks. Y/N feels a bit awkward from his comment, so she says nothing. 

“Where are we going?” Y/N asks queitly, filling the silence of footsteps and their echoes in the hallway. 

“To the office, sweetheart.” Tony replies. “You’ll get your schedule and since you’re with me, and since I'm—well—me, I’ll show you around the school and no teachers will complain that you’re absent!” He says, a bit too excitedly maybe, and Y/N has to look at him to be sure that he’s really that giddy. Because of her?

Surely a guy like him wouldn’t be affected in any way by her. She’s just not that… what he would want. Anyhow. Would she miss the first lessons? But would it be so bad? Passing one day to spend with him? This incredibly handsome stranger Tony. 

How could she actually say no to him? Well, she couldn’t, that’s the thing. She couldn’t deny him, and that’s her weakness. Pretty strangers make her succumb, and it’s not always a good thing. But, alas, this is not a bar, and he’s no creepy guy, so there should be no problem. 

“Okay, but if I fail this semester because I’ve missed a lesson today, I’m blaming you.” She points a mean finger at Tony, which he moves away and leaves them both standing closer than just-met strangers would. Y/N blinks a couple of times, lost in his eyes.

They’re a beautiful shade of brown. A raging, anxious, active, but comforting, deep brown. Beautiful. And he got lost in her eyes, as well, what a coincidence. They’re anxious, like his, he sees, and finds comfort in that. But they’re calming, too. The orbs are understanding and look like the deepest ocean.

“I'm sure I can take the blame.” He says, talking quieter than before, the foolish smile gone from his features. A blush invades her cheeks and she looks down, looks away from Tony. He closes his eyes for a second, but then turns and starts walking again down the hallway, Y/N following him soon after. She’s shy now, they’ve both gotten shy. Tony doesn’t speak a thing. How strange for his usual behavior that Y/N knows nothing of. “So, uh, any plans for the summer?” He asks.

“Tony, it has just ended.” Y/N says to him and Tony almost faints. The way she says his name. So innocently, so purely and shyly. He’s ready to give her his heart. “Summer’s next year.”

“Still, have any plans already?” He repeats his question. Tony’s realised his clumsiness but tries to make it better, still tries to keep up a conversation with the beautiful creature. 

“No, I don’t think so.” She responds. “Probably sleeping. I get very tired during the school year.” 

“From all the studying and working hard and late?” Tony asks, a knowing grin on his lips. 

“Quite so.” Y/N confirms. “What about you?” She looks at him, wicked and interested eyes looking into Tony’s. 

“A year’s the same all around for me, hon.” He admits sorely. “But I would like to join you in sleeping some day.”

Y/N can’t stop the playful scoff, although full of shock, that leaves her mouth. She feels it’s impolite to Tony - if he was either way horribly joking or trying to flirt. But he enjoys it, hearing and seeing her laugh. But he was serious. 

“Show me around first, then we’ll talk of possible, uh, sleeping.” Y/N says to him, patting Tony’s shoulder. That’s strange, he’s never had someone playing with him like that. Everyone is always serious and modest towards him. 

“I’ll strongly take that as permission.” Tony tells her. She only laughs quietly, more to herself than Tony. And she shakes her head. He’s unbelievably sure of himself. 

Even though they are faintly flirting and catching glimpses at one another, as well as knowing there’s some kind of attraction to each other, they don’t otherwise speak of it out loud. That would be a crime! They’ve only known each other for two or three minutes, not known, but met. 

But they know, they knew from that moment, that they were undeniably and absolutely smitten by each other. 

Permanent taglist: @v0idbella @inlovewithmiddleagedcelebs @works-of-fanfiction @destiel-stucky4ever-loki-queen @stfxlou @ur-gunna-h8-ths @one-taylor-one-vision @empressdreams @betweenloveandfire @but-legendsneverdie @deardeacy @mavieesttriste16 @fvckyeahbenhardy @thewinchesterchronicles

A/N: Forgive the ending, it sounds like a corny teen movie’s beginning narration. Also, I finished watching Restoration and I have exploded because o h my god. my kink is actually men with long hair. i mean, i’ve already fallen in love with downey, but this look,,,, W O W. Have a good night!

I don’t know your name, but you seem to have drifted, so—”

“Yes, we’re going.” He says and starts walking in the direction Y/N was already headed to. “I should probably tell you who I am.” He says it in a way that makes her think she should know his name, know who he is. As if it’s a fact. “I’m Tony. Tony Stark.” He extends his hand towards her again and this time, she shakes it. Even if she is unsure of the horrid formality of his gestures. 

“I’m Y/N.” She says in response and realises she doesn’t know his name, even if she’s supposed to. “I would say my last name, but since yours is much more brighter and cooler, I won’t.” She admits.

“Ridiculous!” Tony says. “Although, thank you, I know it’s cool. Or whatever.” He takes it as a compliment, due to his arrogant ways. Back to my own self, at least, he thinks. Y/N feels a bit awkward from his comment, so she says nothing. 

“Where are we going?” Y/N asks queitly, filling the silence of footsteps and their echoes in the hallway. 

“To the office, sweetheart.” Tony replies. “You’ll get your schedule and since you’re with me, and since I'm—well—me, I’ll show you around the school and no teachers will complain that you’re absent!” He says, a bit too excitedly maybe, and Y/N has to look at him to be sure that he’s really that giddy. Because of her?

Surely a guy like him wouldn’t be affected in any way by her. She’s just not that… what he would want. Anyhow. Would she miss the first lessons? But would it be so bad? Passing one day to spend with him? This incredibly handsome stranger Tony. 

How could she actually say no to him? Well, she couldn’t, that’s the thing. She couldn’t deny him, and that’s her weakness. Pretty strangers make her succumb, and it’s not always a good thing. But, alas, this is not a bar, and he’s no creepy guy, so there should be no problem. 

“Okay, but if I fail this semester because I’ve missed a lesson today, I’m blaming you.” She points a mean finger at Tony, which he moves away and leaves them both standing closer than just-met strangers would. Y/N blinks a couple of times, lost in his eyes.

They’re a beautiful shade of brown. A raging, anxious, active, but comforting, deep brown. Beautiful. And he got lost in her eyes, as well, what a coincidence. They’re anxious, like his, he sees, and finds comfort in that. But they’re calming, too. The orbs are understanding and look like the deepest ocean.

“I'm sure I can take the blame.” He says, talking quieter than before, the foolish smile gone from his features. A blush invades her cheeks and she looks down, looks away from Tony. He closes his eyes for a second, but then turns and starts walking again down the hallway, Y/N following him soon after. She’s shy now, they’ve both gotten shy. Tony doesn’t speak a thing. How strange for his usual behavior that Y/N knows nothing of. “So, uh, any plans for the summer?” He asks.

“Tony, it has just ended.” Y/N says to him and Tony almost faints. The way she says his name. So innocently, so purely and shyly. He’s ready to give her his heart. “Summer’s next year.”

“Still, have any plans already?” He repeats his question. Tony’s realised his clumsiness but tries to make it better, still tries to keep up a conversation with the beautiful creature. 

“No, I don’t think so.” She responds. “Probably sleeping. I get very tired during the school year.” 

“From all the studying and working hard and late?” Tony asks, a knowing grin on his lips. 

“Quite so.” Y/N confirms. “What about you?” She looks at him, wicked and interested eyes looking into Tony’s. 

“A year’s the same all around for me, hon.” He admits sorely. “But I would like to join you in sleeping some day.”

Y/N can’t stop the playful scoff, although full of shock, that leaves her mouth. She feels it’s impolite to Tony - if he was either way horribly joking or trying to flirt. But he enjoys it, hearing and seeing her laugh. But he was serious. 

“Show me around first, then we’ll talk of possible, uh, sleeping.” Y/N says to him, patting Tony’s shoulder. That’s strange, he’s never had someone playing with him like that. Everyone is always serious and modest towards him. 

“I’ll strongly take that as permission.” Tony tells her. She only laughs quietly, more to herself than Tony. And she shakes her head. He’s unbelievably sure of himself. 

Even though they are faintly flirting and catching glimpses at one another, as well as knowing there’s some kind of attraction to each other, they don’t otherwise speak of it out loud. That would be a crime! They’ve only known each other for two or three minutes, not known, but met. 

But they know, they knew from that moment, that they were undeniably and absolutely smitten by each other.

summary: Angels Among Us
title: Angels Among Us
body:
“Nat! Hey, Nat, we’re gonna be late. Get a move on.” Tony said as he walked into the dance studio.

Natasha finished a graceful Grande Jeté before she turned to Tony and scowled lightly. The sun through the floor to ceiling windows caught in her red, red hair, giving the illusion that it was on fire.

“Tony, you know as well as I do that it is impossible for us to be ‘late’ for anything. Time is relative here.”

Tony shrugged. “So sue me. I like to maintain a semblance of normalcy. Now c'mon. Morgan’s dance recital starts in 15 minutes and I don’t want to be late.”

Natasha huffed out a sigh before grabbing a towel and stalking off. Tony ambled up from the dance studio and into the living room of the Malibu mansion. Apart from the new dance studio, created just for Natasha in this version of reality, it was as if Tony had stepped back in time. The California air was soft and warm, the sound of the waves soothing and the happy cry of birds drifted in through the open patio doors.

“Hey J., what’s on the agenda for tomorrow?” he inquired casually.

“The Barton’s are having a cookout on their farm in Iowa to celebrate Master Nathan’s birthday. I believe that several of the Avengers plan to attend. Master Harley doesn’t know it yet, but he will make a last minute decision to attend a fraternity party at MIT tomorrow evening. I think it best if you tag along.”

“Hmmm, I think you are right, Jarvis. That terror always manages to find trouble. This Guardian Angel gig is harder than I thought it would be.” Tony mused. “Between Peter, Morgan and Harley, my time in the workshop is getting harder and harder to come by. And don’t even get me started on Nebula!” he groused good naturedly. At that moment, Natasha strolled in. Dressed smartly in an elegant summer dress, she was radiant, youthful and beautiful. Tony smiled. One thing about the afterlife that he was really enjoying was the lack of aches and pains from age and hard living. He felt and looked in peak physical condition and so did Natasha. Gone was the worry and strain on her face, the constant pinched look and sadness in her eyes. He knew his own face was free from the lines of age and stress, his body devoid of scars. It was wonderful.

“Ready to hit the road?” he teased, holding out an arm. Natasha smirked and placed her hand around his elbow.

“Ready when you are, you idiot.” she laughed fondly. With a blink, the duo stood at the front of a small auditorium in upstate New York. Glancing around, they easily spotted Pepper, Happy, Rhodey, May and Peter seated just three rows in. They moved to stand directly behind their family. Tony lay one hand on Pepper’s shoulder and brushed a kiss on the top of her head. His wife brushed a hand back to shoo away the feeling of a fly landing on her head and Tony smirked. For a microsecond, his eyes flashed in a multi-colored array and Natasha wondered, not for the first time, if her appearance in this reality had anything to do with Tony’s use of the Infinity Stones. She’d never seen anyone else in this plane of existence. She shrugged it off. She was happy and their lives were full with the various activities of their loved ones and their own personal pursuits. As afterlives went, this one was pretty nice.

On stage, a row of adorable 6 year old girls trooped across the stage, taking their positions. Tony grinned madly at the sight of Morgan, dressed in a tiny pink tutu, purple spangly leotards and a sparkly crown. His heart swelled with love. The music started and Tony thought it was the most adorable performance he had ever seen, tiny little girls trying their best to do the complicated moves, sometimes with hilarious results. When it was over, Tony and Natasha clapped along with everyone else.

“Morgan was definitely the best dancer. She must get that from her Auntie Nat.” Natasha proclaimed smugly. Tony snorted as they placed themselves directly in front of the little girl.

“Watch this, I’ve been practicing something.” he said. With a look of intense concentration on his face, he focused all of his considerable will power on his little girl as Peter handed his 'little sister’ a bouquet of flowers. With a startled gasp the little girl and the young man witnessed a brilliant red and yellow Painted Lady butterfly settle itself gently onto the arm of the little ballerina. They stood transfixed as the butterfly slowly opened and closed it’s wings. A soft gasp behind Tony told him that Pepper was watching as well. After a few moments, the butterfly fluttered off and the 6 year old glanced heavenward.

“Thanks, Daddy.” Morgan whispered just loud enough for Peter to hear. The 18 year olds eyes were wide with wonder as a slow smile crept across his face.

“Oh, I want you to teach me that.” Natasha murmured. “I’d like to try that at my godson’s birthday party tomorrow.”

“Only if you teach me that kinetic punch thing you can do.” Tony retorted.

The moment was interrupted a second later as a shrill beep came from the watch on Peter’s wrist. An echoing beep piped up from Rhodey’s watch. The Avenger alert.

“Sorry, everyone,” Rhodey apologized, “but duty calls. Peter, you ready?”

Peter nodded and the two men excused themselves from the gathering to hurry out the doors. Tony turned to Natasha, her dress already morphing to her signature Black Widow suit.

“Angels Assemble?” he asked with a wicked grin as the Iron Man armor formed around him.

Natasha just rolled her eyes. “Come on, we’ve got work to do.” and winked out. Tony quickly followed.

*Note: True story – several years ago my 15 y/o niece died of bacterial meningitis. My Brother-in-Law understandably went into a spiral of depression. He went outside to have a smoke when a butterfly, something my niece loved and had symbols of all over the place, suddenly lit upon my BIL’s arm. It sat there for several moments, fanning it’s wings, before it fluttered off. My BIL was able to move forward after that. He was convinced it was his little girl saying “Hello, I’m alright.” What’s so special about this? The butterfly came to my BIL on a cold February afternoon in Wisconsin, months out of season.

tags: i cant help but to marvel
summary: Why do so many poc like ironman? Like I get that the first was good but the rest are just money makers and don't critique shit....
question: Why do so many poc like ironman? Like I get that the first was good but the rest are just money makers and don't critique shit. Every white marvel fan I know loves tony stark
answer: Collectively, we have to stop expecting eachother to view everything through a political lense. So the idea that people of color shouldn’t like iron man because the other films don’t critique the establishment implies that we can and should only enjoy things that are progressive and critical. Constantly having to engage in that kind of narrative is exhausting. Sometimes, and I can’t stress this enough, we just want to have fun. Sometimes we just like things because we like them. I’m a fan of iron man because I like him as a character. I’m a fan of Daenerys Targaryen. Does that mean I don’t recognize that she fulfills the white savior trope? No. But if I evaluate every piece of media based on how it fails black women then I will literally never get to have any fun. So to answer your question directly, people of color are people first, and people have a diverse set of interests that lay outside political commentary.

summary: hi so pls consider an au where Steve isn’t fucking dumb and comes back to the present but Tony’s still dead and it’s when...
body: hi so pls consider an au where Steve isn’t fucking dumb and comes back to the present but Tony’s still dead and it’s when they’re reading through tony’s will that they discover tony had secretly made Steve Morgan’s godfather and wow Steve takes that to heart and even though Morgan still has a living guardian Steve vows to live up to this title that he didn’t even know he had and so when pepper and Morgan are getting used to live without their tony Steve stops by every single day without fail, bringing food or gifts or even just his time, a hug, he helps her with his homework and teaches her how to draw, he becomes as close to a parent that anybody else ever could, but most of all he makes sure that little baby Morgan never forgets how amazing and brave her father was and how lucky she is to have a woman like pepper as her mother and they’re all soft and happy and maybe nothing’s okay anymore without tony but damn if anybody’s gonna let Morgan slip even the tiniest bit through the cracks without tony (not to say that pepper isn’t one of the best mother’s in the whole world, but it really takes a village to fill in tony Stark’s shoes yknow)
